headline: American Water Works' Q2 Earnings Lag, Revenues Beat Estimates
summary: AWK's second-quarter earnings narrowly missed estimates, but revenues rose 11% on rate hikes and acquisitions, narrowing 2025 earnings per share guidance.

raw.headline: American Water Works' Q2 Earnings Lag, Revenues Beat Estimates
raw.summary: AWK's second-quarter earnings narrowly missed estimates, but revenues rose 11% on rate hikes and acquisitions, narrowing 2025 earnings per share guidance.

headline: California Water Q2 Earnings Surpass Estimates, Revenues Rise Y/Y
summary: CWT delivers robust Q2 results, with revenues up 8.5% and net income boosted by rising customer demand and rate increases.

raw.headline: California Water Q2 Earnings Surpass Estimates, Revenues Rise Y/Y
raw.summary: CWT delivers robust Q2 results, with revenues up 8.5% and net income boosted by rising customer demand and rate increases.

headline: Investing in the Future: American Water Speaks on Workforce and Water Quality at 2025 NARUC Summer Summit
summary: CAMDEN, N.J., July 31, 2025--American Water (NYSE: AWK), the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the U.S., participated in the 2025 National Association of Regulatory Utility Commissioners (NARUC) Summer Policy Summit, July 27 through July 30, 2025, in Boston, Massachusetts. The Summit brought together state regulators, utility industry leaders and stakeholders to explore pressing issues facing the utility sector, from workforce development to environmental innovation.
